label: 町人
本: Osaka: The Merchants' Capital of Early Modern Japan . Cornell University Press . 1999
著者: McClain, James L.  and Wakita Osamu
説明文: Used in various contexts to mean(1)merchant and artisan landholders; that is, persons who were entitled to possess, rent out, sell, and bequeath specified parcels of land, who paid taxes and levies on those plots, and who were eligible to serve as neighborhood elders; (2)merchants and artisans in general; and(3)all nonsamurai who lived in cities.
